points: Ensure all lease terms are agreed upon.
Both landlord and tenant sign the lease agreement.
Collect proof of identity, employment, and references.
Verify rental insurance if required.

subHeadings.subHeading: Security Deposit and First Month’s Rent
points: Collect security deposit.
Collect the first month’s rent.
Conduct a detailed walk-through with the tenant.
Document the condition of the property using a checklist.
Take photos or videos for records.
Complete any necessary repairs or maintenance.
Ensure all appliances are in working order.
Hand over all necessary keys (front door, mailbox, storage, etc.).
Provide garage door openers or gate access codes if applicable.
Allow the tenant access to the property for moving their belongings.
Ensure utilities (water, electricity, gas) are transferred to the tenant’s name.
Provide information on how to operate appliances and systems (HVAC, alarm, etc.).
Provide emergency contact numbers and procedures.
Share details about local amenities, transportation, and community rules.
Provide garbage collection schedules and recycling procedures.
Conduct a follow-up inspection after a week to address any immediate issues.
Make any necessary adjustments based on the tenant’s feedback.
Set a schedule for regular maintenance checks (filters, smoke detectors, etc.).
Ensure the tenant knows how to report maintenance issues.
Unpack essentials first and set up bedrooms and kitchen.
Arrange furniture and set up utilities like internet and cable.
Update your address with the post office, bank, employer, and other important services.
Notify friends and family of your new address.
Test smoke and carbon monoxide detectors.
Review fire escape routes and emergency procedures.
